algorithm_technique: Monotonic stack to find next greater element for all elements in nums2, then map to nums1
problem_summary_simple: Find the next greater element to the right for each number in nums1 within nums2.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a monotonic decreasing stack and a hashmap to precompute next greater elements for nums2, then maps results for nums1.
key_insights: A monotonic stack is ideal for finding the next greater element efficiently.
Pre-computing the next greater element for all numbers in nums2 using a stack and hashmap allows for O(1) lookups for nums1.
The stack stores elements for which the next greater element hasn't been found yet.
